Some1 here with experience using Retrofit2/Realm?
think you’ll need to write your own mappers between the 2 models
and that’s some fugly code.
or… save the whole thing as json string to sharedprefs… :troll:
I remember reading something that you can use a custom parser to convert a list of string to a comma separated string
but I can’t remember where i read it.
toString does that
[string1, string 3, string 3]
but yeah, either make a wrapper around the string for RealmList or write some mapper that converts from 1 model to other
But then you can’t use realm.copyToRealm
>but yeah, either make a wrapper around the string for RealmList or write some mapper that converts from 1 model to other
I don’t want to do either :smile:
eh, that’s the Realm’s biggest problem imo, until they solve it ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Basically what I’d want is that retrofits converts the array of string to a cs string
<@U0548MM6B>: +1 @ that. But it seems like that’s gonna take a while
why do you need realm?
Cause it’s easy and fast
easy for small models*
type adapter?
if you have to fuck around getting the adapters to work I wouldn’t call it easy.
I’ve used it in plenty of projects before where it did a great job
best thing I’ve found so far was to do the sql mapping manually from retrofit objects.
^ same, i keep response objects separate from persistent models
easier to swap out parts
word. if you’re using rx to communicate from presenter to data layer, you can just map any of them to your model
^ I am
I just remember reading about a custom parser that converts a List<String> into comma seperated string in Retrofit and applying it to the serialised field
But I guess mapping might be a better solution since I only need to extract the id from the url anyhow
Thanks tho :simple_smile:
good luck
thanks

Anyone ever come across crashes from scene transitions? We use makeSceneTransitionAnimation to make shared elements move around in 2 different activities. The trace doesn’t seem to give much, it’s none of our own code in the stack. 

`Attempt to invoke virtual method 'boolean android.view.Window.getAllowExitTransitionOverlap()' on a null object reference`
haven’t been able to google my way out of this one
Ow sorry, try adding these to styles
I think it’s only `<item name="android:windowAllowReturnTransitionOverlap">true</item>` but I can’t remember for sure of the top of my head

Anyone can tell me from where to start with MVP pattern.
I don't know about dagger but I know butter knife and other injection libraries.
Till now we have used old development pattern with data provider and all but now with new project I want to use MVP. As it is more frequently used chat topic and help in code management also.
So any thing will be helpful.
<@U0LJ7U51N>: you can start with this <https://blog.8thlight.com/uncle-bob/2012/08/13/the-clean-architecture.html>

attachments.title: The Clean Architecture | 8th Light
attachments.text: Over the last several years we’ve seen a whole range of ideas regarding the architecture of systems. These include: Hexagonal Architecture (a.k.a. Ports and Adapters) by Alistair Cockburn and adopted by Steve Freeman, and Nat...

text: you dont need dagger for MVP
I'd argue to stay away from dagger until you're absolutely sure you need it
adds a lot of complexity otherwise
agree
plus you start thinking twice about dependencies if you have to handle them the “hard way"
> adds a lot of complexity otherwise
Not really
^^ Agree, the point of dagger is to reduce complexity
if you don’t need it it adds a lot of complexity
on a big app where you DO need it, it reduces it :simple_smile:
but if you’re doing a 2 screen app then you probably don’t need it
Yeah I wouldn’t in a small app, less dependencies == better.  But most stuff I work on for work and personal is large or has plans to be large, so I integrate dagger right of the bat
If I use MVP, I use dagger. I have a pretty straight forward basic setup, where my presenters are automatically create due to DI.
Anyhow, you don’t need dagger for MVP. which was the original point.

>on a big app where you DO need it, it reduces it :simple_smile:
>but if you’re doing a 2 screen app then you probably don’t need it

word.

Thanks guys.
I will check link. 
But I am googling and found one github project with nimble. 
But from over view I can say it increase files for Project so what is benefit of MVP ?
<@U0LJ7U51N>: lots of benefits, the link will give you a perfect view of why bothering with a clean architecture
basically you get to hot swap components of your code way easier and your code is way more testable

As android use single thread policy. Using MVP I think for one view I have to load 3-4 files as per code.
It will not affect performance ?
spaghetti code and 1500+ LOC activity classes tend to be somewhat worse for performance than using the MVP pattern
it’s worse for performance, and worse for your life as developer also
just make sure you don’t have enums :troll:
the intital project verbosity is a small trade off for increased readability and maintainability
<@U0N4RS70W> thanks :domo:
<@U0PGWV083|swarup> has joined the channel
Hi all. I am a beginner and just have a question on fragment vs activity
go on
maybe that was it. he just wanted to state the fact that he had a question. <@U0PGWV083>  what’s your question?
/gif ask your question
also fyi, there’s a beginners channel for beginner friendly q&a
Yeah I think he just wanted to let us know he had a question
Takes a tremendous amount of strength to admit that you have a question
Much respect dude

I am making an app from scratch. just wondering, say if user will navigate from one tab to another (for example in instagram, in bottom menu (home->profile->camera->etc) each of them will call a new activity? or one activity can hold 4 fragment
I mean which one will be a better practice?
This is my question guys. And I have one follow up question to this as well. Let's see who has a quick answer
Don’t ask to ask
just ask
Activity will have ViewPager
ViewPager will have fragments
so you can have 4 fragments in a single activity
what's your opinion on load shedding then, in this case? cause (say in my app I have 4 bottom tab, 1. feed 2. user profile 3. Chat 4. Camera etc.)
You are asking or playing game ? :grinning: :grinning: :notbad:
I m serious, I just said I am a beginner :stuck_out_tongue:
Just started 5 days before
Try it out and see what happens
seriously, you are worried over nothing
But have some sense of asking someone man
Like nish said, you have fragments that are like iFrames, and the main activity which is the Window. When you want different tabs and swiping between different pages, you use a ViewPager
So then, one activity is good to go with in most cases?
Depends on your usecase
just a logic
an activity is like a route in a website
if your site is only one mainpage with 4 iframes that you can swipe back and forth, then yes
makes sense
If your fragment is trying to calculate the meaning of life
but most apps need other “pages” too, like a settings page, an account page, etc...
4 of them might be a lot
those all need to be activities
And why you want to give such functionality in same activity.
say, in a social networking app
Use other fragments or activity b'z it will be hard to handle different response in tabs
stages are (login process then feed + profile + message and etc)
Use navigation drawer to navigate users to those activity
that's what i meant, would it be difficult to handle all these 4 things in an activity? if yes should I make each of them a different activity
sure I ll check
<@U0PGWV083>: should be easy enough… imo
Yes or create fragments to reduce back button hurdles
but like insta, lovoo all these app, do they use fragment or each action each activity?

not sure, but this is a similar question all of us have had at one time or another. lots of people with much more thorough explanations on stack overflow. <http://stackoverflow.com/a/25993052/2532762>

attachments.title: Dilemma: when to use Fragments vs Activities:
attachments.text: I know that Activities are designed to represent a single screen of my application, while Fragments are designed to be reusable UI layouts with logic embedded inside of them. Until not long ago, I
attachments.fallback: Dilemma: when to use Fragments vs Activities:

text: bcz it might carter large userspace in future
I think fragments b'z tabs and view pager works well with fragments
checking <@U08GFT5V5>
okay let's add a total different dimension, may be it will simplify this dilemma upto an extent
As 1st, user has to log in, which is the main activity screen
after login all these 4 tabs are there which we may keep in post login activity with 4 different fragments for easy back and data transfer
Is it a good practice to keep login and post login as two different activities?
You are overthinking this
Seriously, just write the code
You’ll figure it out on the way
no you tell me what would have been your approach in general
Mine would be to keep the login in another activity.
my approach would have been to just write the code :trollface:
Seriously though…
Think of a website
too much mainstream :stuck_out_tongue: :smile:
If you need to redirect, then Activity
If you have a box and another box in the same window
fragment
got it
yeah, you’re redirecting, use activity.
Now stop over thinking
if ever in the future you want to have 2 activities next to eachother, in the case of a tablet lets say, you can’t so this can lead you to develop some activities as fragments as well.
and just go write code
/gif go forth
you mean, adding process oriented dimension, yeah that's pretty smooth. nice example
thanks
I agree with nish, either read the excellent resources on stackoverflow, or start coding. Nothing said here hasn’t been said 100 times online
but seriously this is another level in touch and feel. thanks every one
game on
anyone notice that 23.2.0 breaks their app’s layouts?

what's breaking?
R.drawable.abc_ic_ab_back_mtrl_am_alpha was’t found anymore, saw a reference that there are no images in raster format anymore because of the vector drawable
also, my recyclerview layout isnt working lol
had a bunch of rows, ill figure more out… just seeing if anyone else had this
no idea about the drawable, i know i haven't seen issues with recyclerview using gridlayoutmanager
but the layout isn't too complex
the resources (finally) hide properly
you shouldn’t be using private resources of libraries
